blocks.text:
7. The current from a battery was measured at various times, with the following results:

Time (hours) :    0       1       2       3       4       5
Current (amperes) :  0      12      24      33      35      32

If its capacity is measured by $\int_{0}^{5} I(t) dt$ in ampere-hours, where $I(t)$ is the current in amperes.

The table below gives approximate speeds of a locomotive on a run over a now slightly level road. Draw a curve showing the distance run up to any time.

Speed (miles per hour) :                        0           5          10         20       30       40
Time (hours) :                                  0           1           2           3          4          5

Load (1000 pounds) :                             0           1          2          3           4           5
Time (hours) :                                  0           1          2          3          4          5

\[ 2 \cdot 3 \cdot 44 \cdot 5  \text{ of the current curve can be constructed from the following data.} \]

Velocity (ft/sec) : 76       78       76       72       67       63
Time (seconds) :   0       10      20      30      40      50

10. The velocity of a three-phase electric train, with rheostatic control, at various times, was found to be:

Velocity (ft/sec) :  16       20       25       30
Time (seconds) :      0       10       20       30

12. At $t = 0 $ sec, $\; x = 0 $ and $\; y = 14$.

13. $\int x^{2} dx = \frac{x^{3}}{3} + C$

14. $\int \frac{1}{x} dx = \ln |x| + C$ 

15. $\int e^{x} dx = e^{x} + C$ 

16. $\int a^{x} dx = \frac{a^{x}}{\ln a} + C$
